pageContext.claim: “You have areas where you literally have roads that are carved in the sand that it's used so much. They go right through these roads. They go right, they hang a left and hang another left, and "Welcome to the United States." There's nobody there to even talk to them. Because you're talking about 2,000 miles.”
pageContext.analysis: For most of the border’s 2,000 miles, about 700 miles have existing barriers, while large portions without barriers have treacherous terrain. There are few roads near the border, with the exception of some dirt paths carved by Border Patrol agents, according to The Post.
